36#include "krb5_locl.h"
37
38KRB5_LIB_FUNCTION krb5_error_code KRB5_LIB_CALL
39krb5_mk_error_ext(krb5_context context,
40 krb5_error_code error_code,
41 const char *e_text,
42 const krb5_data *e_data,
43 const krb5_principal server,
44 const PrincipalName *client_name,
45 const Realm *client_realm,
46 time_t *client_time,
47 int *client_usec,
48 krb5_data *reply)
49{
50 const char *e_text2 = NULL;
51 KRB_ERROR msg;
52 krb5_timestamp sec;
53 int32_t usec;
54 size_t len = 0;
55 krb5_error_code ret = 0;
56
57 krb5_us_timeofday (context, &sec, &usec);
58
59 memset(&msg, 0, sizeof(msg));
60 msg.pvno = 5;
61 msg.msg_type = krb_error;
62 msg.stime = sec;
63 msg.susec = usec;
64 msg.ctime = client_time;
65 msg.cusec = client_usec;
66 /* Make sure we only send `protocol' error codes */
67 if(error_code < KRB5KDC_ERR_NONE || error_code >= KRB5_ERR_RCSID) {
68 if(e_text == NULL)
69 e_text = e_text2 = krb5_get_error_message(context, error_code);
70 error_code = KRB5KRB_ERR_GENERIC;
71 }
72 msg.error_code = error_code - KRB5KDC_ERR_NONE;
73 if (e_text)
74 msg.e_text = rk_UNCONST(&e_text);
75 if (e_data)
76 msg.e_data = rk_UNCONST(e_data);
77 if(server){
78 msg.realm = server->realm;
79 msg.sname = server->name;
80 }else{
81 static char unspec[] = "<unspecified realm>";
82 msg.realm = unspec;
83 }
84 msg.crealm = rk_UNCONST(client_realm);
85 msg.cname = rk_UNCONST(client_name);
86
87 ASN1_MALLOC_ENCODE(KRB_ERROR, reply->data, reply->length, &msg, &len, ret);
88 if (e_text2)
89 krb5_free_error_message(context, e_text2);
90 if (ret)
91 return ret;
92 if(reply->length != len)
93 krb5_abortx(context, "internal error in ASN.1 encoder");
94 return 0;
95}
96
97KRB5_LIB_FUNCTION krb5_error_code KRB5_LIB_CALL
98krb5_mk_error(krb5_context context,
99 krb5_error_code error_code,
100 const char *e_text,
101 const krb5_data *e_data,
102 const krb5_principal client,
103 const krb5_principal server,
104 time_t *client_time,
105 int *client_usec,
106 krb5_data *reply)
107{
108 const PrincipalName *client_name = NULL;
109 const Realm *client_realm = NULL;
110
111 if (client) {
112 client_realm = &client->realm;
113 client_name = &client->name;
114 }
115
116 return krb5_mk_error_ext(context, error_code, e_text, e_data,
117 server, client_name, client_realm,
118 client_time, client_usec, reply);
119}
